fields.description:
1. Select some text in the RTE
2. open the link browser
3. attach a file and click insert
fields.summary: Inserting an attachment link in the RTE is broken

fields.description: The {{AttachmentListEntity}} maps each element in the attachment as <attachments>, it should be <attachment>
fields.summary: Attachment list xml element name incorrect
Warning messages that index is currently being rebuilt

fields.description: Replace the {{CacheControlFilter}} with an interceptor which will be available in REST 1.2
fields.summary: Implement REST Cache Control using new Interceptor model

fields.description: CONF-18547 requires the auto-complete to be able to launch the Link Browser with either a default Confluence search performed, or a Web-link pre-filled.
fields.summary: GWT Links Browser missing hooks needed by Autocomplete

fields.description:
* Set language to French
* Use the RTE - note the text on the insert menu button
* Switch to full screen mode

The text is now truncated. See screenshots.
fields.summary: Insert Menu button text is truncated in Full Screen Mode for French and German

fields.description:
Autocomplete is receiving and displaying data from the REST API in this order: Users, Content, Attachments, Spaces

QuickNav shows matches in this order: Content, Attachments, Users, Spaces

The REST API should match this latter order, as users are accustomed to looking in the same place for object types.
fields.summary: REST API: Change order of items sent to Autocomplete

fields.description:
The OSUser and Atlassian-User authenticators used by Confluence convert a password into bytes before hashing it. This conversion doesn't specify which encoding should be used, so the system's default encoding is used.

If the system administrator changes the locale settings on the server or changes the 'file.encoding' system property value, users with characters with a different encoded value in the old encoding will not longer be able to authenticate. For example, if your password was 'café' and you changed from Latin1 to UTF-8, you would no longer be able to authenticate.
fields.summary: Changing system locale means users with non-ASCII characters in their passwords cannot authenticate

fields.description:
* Use Safari
* Add a page and switch to the RTE
* Press Ctrl+Shift+F to go to full screen mode
* Press Ctrl+Shift+F to leave full screen mode
* Press any keys - nothing happens as the cursor focus is no longer in the editor.



This also affects IE6,IE7,IE8. It works as expected on Firefox.
fields.summary: Editor loses focus when toggling full screen mode in Safari and IE

fields.description: The JSON deserialisation does not handle the content entity class in confluence. Some fields are not de-serialised properly, in the testcase the title was set properly but the id was not.
fields.summary: JSon deserialisation broken

fields.description:
* Use Safari
* Add a page and switch to the RTE
* open the Macro Browser
* Press Escape to cancel the MB
* reopen the Macro Browser
* Type some text

The text is typed into the greyed out editor, instead of in the Macro Browser search field.  This could be quite annoying for Safari users.
fields.summary: Opening Macro Browser after ESCaping it first doesn't transfer cursor to search field

fields.description:
This is thrown by the SessionDraftDao.getDraft(Long) method.

To reproduce:
- Edit a page and click preview to save a draft.
- Navigate back to the page (dont save)
- Edit the page again - note the draft exists banner.
- In another tab log out.
- In the edit page tab click save, notice the UnsupportedOperationException.

fields.summary: UnsupportedOperationException thrown when saving a page edit after logging out in another tab when a draft already exists.
Remove permission check for links in a page

fields.description:
* Create a space using the Left Nav or Click theme
* Add a page
* Click on the macro browser icon

There is a popup message saying:

{noformat}There has been an error loading the macro browser. Please try again or see your system administrator{noformat}
fields.summary: Macro Browser cannot be used in Left Nav and Clickr themes
Fixed width theme shouldn't apply to body tag

fields.description:
After upgrading QA-EAC to 3.2-m4, the dashboard is showing an error:

{noformat}Error formatting macro: recently-updated-dashboard: java.lang.NullPointerException {noformat}
fields.summary: Recently Updated Dashboard macro is failing with a NPE
Space Export to HTML is failing with a NPE on EAC due to data problem. Handle more gracefully

fields.description:
When doing a document import for the attached document, the numbering is imported incorrectly. The third numbered line is imported as "1." when the word document shows it as 3.

However, attaching the file to the page, and clicking "View" from the attachment page, presents the numbers correctly.
fields.summary: Incorrect numbering in imported document

fields.description: Caused by a REST api bug
fields.summary: Link browser can sometimwes show the wrong breadcrumbs for a search result

fields.description:
See this link 

https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/search.json?search=site&query=confluence

The fourth search result has the wrong content ID. You will notice that a different ID is used for the object link. This causes the breadcrumbs for some items in the link browser search results to be wrong. See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: REST json sometimes returns wrong content id
When editing an existing link breadcrumbs sometimes appear as all ellipsis

fields.description:
1. Open the link browser
2. Double click on the recently viewed tab
3. One spinner will remain forever

This also occurs on the attachments tab and the search button in the search tab.
fields.summary: Double clicking on the recently viewed tab of the link browser results in two spinners
Have a setting in the feed builder to only show pages updated since last check

fields.description: Must search and destroy remaining hardcoded en-gb.
fields.summary: Editor Autocomplete needs i18n

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18631].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:
- Using *test* as the search term on a page in space with key *TEST*, after waiting/performing full indexing

When using the {{*rootPage*}} parameter, {{{*pagetreesearch*}}} returns no results
- URL generated by {{{*pagetreesearch:rootPage=Test:Home*}}} macro:
\\http://hostname/dosearchsite.action?searchQuery.queryString=ancestorIds%3A262146+AND+test&searchQuery.spaceKey=TEST

  After seeing the {{{*pagetreesearch*}}} no results page, the _lucene_ *Search* button needs to be pressed to get the result bearing URL
- URL generated by Confluence inbuilt search:
\\ http://hostname/dosearchsite.action?queryString=ancestorIds%3A262146+AND+test&where=conf_all&type=&lastModified=&contributor=&contributorUsername=

\\
Workaround (does not always work):
- {{{*pagetreesearch*}}} results appear on first go when {{*rootPage*}} is not used (_lucene_ *Search* button does not need to be pressed to see the results)
- if a {{{*pagetreesearch*}}} with no {{*rootPage*}} parameter is executed and results appear (as in the previous point), going back to the {{*rootPage*}} parameter equivalent of the macro will then provide result on first go, possibly only for that same search term
fields.summary: {pagetreesearch:rootPage=...} macro parameter does not yield results of new queries

fields.description: improve ui in accordance to [https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-1109]

fields.description:
The link to the UWC in Confluence's admin console goes to the old, deprecated documentation.  Please update the link to have it go to either pac or PStudio

Pac - https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/14575

PStudio - https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/x/H4Mi
fields.summary: UWC Link in Confluence Administration is broken

fields.description:
After upgrading from 2.10.3 to 3.1 the configuration change we had made which auto-added users who login (we are pulling credentials from our onsite AD server) to the confluence-users group no longer appears to be working.  I made the same change to the seraph-config.xml file that we made in 2.10.3 to ensure that this login hook worked but it does not appear to be working.  The link we added/changed was

<authenticator class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator"/>

For users that already had been made a member of the confluence-users group this does not appear to be an issue it is only causing new users issues.

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Users not being auto-added to confluence-users group

fields.description:
Since upgrading from Confluence 2.10.3 to 3.1 the dynamic task list macro does not allow editing or adding of new tasks. The UI appears to submit the AJAX request but the following JavaScript error is generated.

Error: this.enableTaskAdding is not a function
Source File: https://beta.wiki.cabelas.corp/s/1722/2/3.2.5.1/_/download/batch/confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources/confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js
Line: 130

We have uninstalled and re-installed the dynamic tasklist in both our beta and production instances of the Confluence wiki but this did not solve the issue.

The JS error is "{{linkDetails.destination is undefined}}"

fields.description:
The 'Create a space' , 'Feed Builder' and 'People Directory' actions on the Dashboard are _hidden_ below the spaces list. When you have a Confluence instance with  large number of spaces you need to scroll to the bottom of the Dashboard to see them.

Let's move them to a new spot on the Dashboard so they get more visibility, possibly above the spaces list.
fields.summary: Move Dashboard Actions so they are more visible

fields.description:
Some small but far-reaching changes to our use of the Atlassian-User APIs:

- don't use setters on the User interface -- use DefaultUser instead
- use createUser(User, Credential) instead of createUser(String)
- don't use memory implementations for unit testing.
fields.summary: Improve usage of Atlassian-User APIs

fields.description:
We've been discussing the need to bundle the Invite Plugin with Confluence for a long time now. Sales feels that it's a really important part of improving the evaluator experience and spurring adoption.

There are a few outstanding issues that need to be resolved before it can be bundled with Confluence. See Sherif's email to David Chui below:

{quote}
Hey David,
I had a session with the Sales guys looking at evaluator improvements for Confluence. One of the things that came up with the possibility of what bundling the invite plugin in an upcoming release. This would help with wiki adoption and in allowing administrators to promote the use of Confluence within their organisations. 

Per advised that there may have been some security implications or things that need to be done to the plugin first before it could get bundled. 

Just wondering if you could let me know your thoughts on what we would need to do if we wanted to bundle the plugin for a Confluence release. 

Sherif
{quote}
fields.summary: Support and bundle the Invite Plugin

fields.description:

fields.description:
The "patterns" option of the \{attachments\} macro throws an error.

Example:
\{attachments:patterns=*.gif\}

Output:
Error formatting macro: attachments: java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException: Dangling meta character '*' near index 0 *.gif ^

Live example:
http://shawnstepper.com/wiki/display/~stepper/attachments+bug
fields.summary: "patterns" option throws an error in {attachments} macro

fields.description:
A simple manual test shows the following memory usage in IE7.

|| Activity || Memory Usage || Approx. Leak Size ||
| View Page | 50,712K | |
| Launch Move Dialog Browse Panel | 64,392K | |
| Reload Page | 55,188K | 4,476K |
| Launch Move Dialog Browse Panel | 68,004K | |
| Reload Page | 59,280K | 4,092K |
| Launch Move Dialog Browse Panel | 71,392K | |
| Reload Page | 62,212K | 2,932K |
| Launch Move Dialog Browse Panel | 74,288K | |
| Reload Page | 65,380K |  3,168K |
| Launch Move Dialog Browse Panel | 77,420K | |
| Reload Page | 69,240K | 3,860K  |

So each time the browse panel is loaded we seem to lose between 3 and 4.5Mb of memory in IE. There are quite a number of tests in this area and this is probably leading to timeout issues and long test run durations in our IE Selenium tests.

I don't know if this is an issue on other browsers yet.
fields.summary: Move Page Dialog has a memory leak in IE on the browse tab
404 returned for existing content if user is not allowed to see it

fields.description:
When you edit a page, the lastupdated field for Contributors-Summary Marco does not update.
Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a page
2) Add the macro
3) Add some basic content
4) Save the page - the macro will display "less than a minute ago" for last edit
5) Wait 2 minutes
6) go back and edit the page as another user.
7) the marco does not update the lastupdated field.

The screenshot shows last updated by admin on page created and edited line. However the contributor marco shows lastupdated by han. I've reindex the instance and the problem presists. There's no error in the log files
fields.summary: Contributors-Summary Marco for lastupdated not working

fields.description:
I just had a weird, really annoying experience. I used page-up and page-down to scroll through a long page : https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/XHTML+Survey+Feedback

Autocomplete just popped open every few page-up (!) keypresses, and thereby (after closing the autocomplete mode) left some annoying exlamation-marks in the text. 


Rating it as critical because it disrupts me when I didn't ask for it.
fields.summary: Autocomplete opens accidentally on page-up

fields.description:
MIME types issues with the "drag and drop" method (google gears) in Confluence 3.1.

Using WEBDAV with Internet Explorer (IE8), the additional MIME types (for example: type PPTX) can be added in mime.types in <confluence installation dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes dir. Then the file can be uploaded and downloaded properly in IE.

However, the new "drag and drop" method (google gears) in Confluence 3.1 doesn't respect the additional file types being added in the mime.types file. 

Included below are the results from the user troubleshooting the drag and drop method and WebDAV method in Confluence 3.1:

After adding pptx file type extension to the mime.types file and upload/download the file. 

When attempting to download the file through the interface, the results are (File x Downloading Browser):

WebDAV x Firefox = OK
WebDAV x IE = OK

Firefox via Gears x Firefox = OK
Firefox via Gears x IE = Fail, Attempts to download as .ZIP
IE via Gears x IE = Fail, Attempts to download as .ZIP
fields.summary: MIME types issues with "drag and drop" method in Confluence 3.1

fields.description: In Confluence Admin > OAuth, the Consumers, Consumer Info and Service Providers tabs seem to be coded to use the configured Server Base URL instead of the current contextPath.  For example, if my server base url is set to maleko:8080 and I'm accessing Admin > OAuth from localhost:8080, when I try to access one of those tabs, I am sent to a broken page at maleko:8080/plugins/servlet/oauth/view-consumer-info.  Consider using something like $req.contextPath instead.
fields.summary: OAuth Administration tab links are not relative

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18572].
  {panel}

The 'Edit Document' button (which floats to the left of Word content) is great. However, floating isnt always the best option and it consumes real estate.
This is a real problem when pages contain multiple columns with Word tables in each column.
We can live with the float, but only if we can change the text in the button to just say 'Edit' (ie not 'Edit Document') so it consumes less real estate.
To achieve our goals, we had to edit the conversion.vm file within the templates folder in the office connector jar archive.
It would be very useful if the following settings could be made available in the office connector config page:
1. Edit text within the 'Edit Document' button
2. Edit border style settings around office container (dashed, solid, none)

Thanks,

Sean
fields.summary: office connector 'edit document' button and other settings within conversion.vm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18571].
  {panel}

The autocomplete feature makes it simple to display images from other pages in Confluence, which was previously not easy to do.

However, there is no simple way to insert these images as thumbnails. The autocomplete will add them full-size, and the image browser will only show images attached to the current page.

Therefore, to show a thumbnail version of an image from another page, an RTE user must find it, insert it, then switch to wiki markup and add the correct syntax.

This is not very user-friendly.
fields.summary: Usability: There is no easy way to display a thumbnail of a linked image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18565].
  {panel}

[Shortcut Links|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Shortcut+Links] are a massively useful feature of Confluence, but one that is largely unknown and unused by users as it is not easily discoverable.

Currently, shortcut links are configured by admin users on an admin-only screen, and there is no way for non-admin users to see what shortcuts are available.

The redesign of the links browser provides an ideal opportunity to promote this existing feature more:
* A new tab showing the available shortcut links
* Ability to enter a key and an alias using the shortcut links
* A link to the 'Contact Admins' page for new shortcuts to be requested
* User documentation on the feature
fields.summary: Links Browser: Should provide visibility of available shortcut links

fields.description:
When quicknav searching by page title in the link browser, only a very small portion of the page titles are shown.

This makes it difficult to use when there are many pages with similarly named titles.

Either the dropdown should be larger to show more of the titles, or there should be tooltips to see the entire title. Or both.

See screenshot for an illustration of the problem.
fields.summary: Links Browser: Usability: There is no way to see the entire title for pages with long titles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18556].
  {panel}

I'd like to see a feature where you specify, through a macro, a page accessible by an http URL to be brought down by Confluence and rendered as if it contained wiki markup. 

I have a script that can output valid confluence wiki markup and I'd like to have this run automatically and leave its output on a web server. This feature would allow confluence to grab that file each time a particular wiki page was viewed, and render its contents as if they were part of the page. Almost like an include() for wiki markup. 

I have described this problem on the atlassian forums: 

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=40599&tstart=0

This feature would be very useful to our operation in organizing dynamic data.
fields.summary: Support fetch-and-render for files served by http containing Confluence wiki markup

fields.description:
Adding a link is UNBELIEVABLY slow using the existing method. It takes about 6 seconds to pop-up a new window on Firefox or IE, about 4 seconds in Opera.

Please don't subject us to this kind of delays just for a link. There's no need to fetch a new page from the server just to add a link. Use AJAX if available. It will speed things up incredibly. Please see http://stackoverflow.com or the wmd page (http://wmd-editor.com/examples/splitscreen) for examples.
fields.summary: Use AJAX for adding HTML links
ChildPositionComparator deprecated without alternative

fields.description:
When exporting a flow chart using the {flowchart} macro the PDF is generated without exception but missing the chart.
This seems to be consistent for small and large charts.
This condition has also been reproduced on a clean standalone installation.
fields.summary: PDF export of flow charts fails without stacktrace
Improve Info, Note, Warning, Tip & Panel Macro Styling

fields.description:
The new image browser in 3.1 made image insertion much easier and sexier than in previous versions. One thing I noticed, however, is that once you insert an image you can't go back an edit it with the image browser (the previous image browser supported editing of existing images). To change the image properties, you now either have to delete the image and start over or go into wiki markup and make the edits, neither of which is desirable.

I would like the ability to select an image in the RTE, launch the image browser, and have all the image properties pre-populated such that you can edit them. The previous image browser supported this.
fields.summary: Ability to edit existing images with the new image browser
global-reports macro gives a "Page Not Found' error for 'undefined" and "arent linked" links

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# As a test user, visit some pages in your local instance
# Check http://localhost:8080/confluence/rest/prototype/1/session/history.json as the test user, all should be fine
# As another user, remove permission for the test user to view one of the pages
# Check the rest URL again as the test user, there will be a null where the content used to be

Fixing this *seems* as simple as putting a null check in DefaultRestUserSessionManager.getUserSession, but the problem is that the history size is reported without checking if the history items are accessible.

This issue is minor but blocks CONF-18537.
fields.summary: REST history returns nulls if no content exists (or permitted) for an id

fields.description:
Under certain circumstances the viewmylabels.action doesn't work and instead tells our users.
{noformat}
The following error(s) occurred:    
* You are not permitted to view another users labels.
{noformat}

I think the root cause of this bug is actually a bug from when we migrated our Confluence from direct LDAP authentication to Crowd authentication.
For example, my local Confluence user name is - somehow - 'Jeff Kirby' while my user name in Crowd is 'jeff kirby'.
Confluence lets me log in and do everything using either user name except viewmylabels.action.
See the attachment debugged.png.
fields.summary: viewmylabels.action leads to incorrect permission violation error

fields.description:
On a page of company employee photos displayed via the gallery macro there are 286 attached photo files.
You can see all employees photos on the page yet when you navigate to the Attachment view you only see 20 files and no way to navigate to the others.
fields.summary: Page with 286 attachments only shows first 20 on Attachment View

fields.description:
if you edit a page in a space and change the title of the page to just a space character (' ') and save it the request will be ok and the page gets saved. the page title is then possibly shown as 'null'.

but now there is no possibility to change the page again because the title in the database for the corresponding page is '(null)' and every request (editing,removing,viewing the page in the page hierarchy of the space) results in errors. if you watch the alphabetical page listing of that space you will see a page with velocities unresolved page title ({{$webwork.htmlEncode($page.title)}}).

maybe there are more leaks i did not see.

i think a request to change a title to only a space character should generally be refused.
fields.summary: changing a page title to space character (' ') makes a page immutable
Update documentation to ask for manual thread dumps.

fields.summary: Fixed width theme shouldn't affect space admin

fields.description:
Theme stylesheets get served by {{/styles/combined.css}} as CSS imports. This doesn't work very well when you have an IE stylesheet defined e.g.
{code:xml}
<resource name="fixedwidth-ie.css" type="download" location="fixedwidth/css/fixedwidth-ie.css">
          <param name="ieonly" value="true"/>
 </resource>
{code}

It always gets included in the combined.css request.
fields.summary: IE stylesheets defined in Themes don't get served with IE conditional comments

fields.description: There is currently no nice way of loading all the i18n for a plugin in javascript. It would be nice if there such an API. e.g. AJS.I18n.load(PLUGIN_KEY), AJS.I18n.getText(KEY)
fields.summary: Add service for getting i18n from plugins

fields.description: The text for comments appears to be duplicated in IE. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Text for comments is duplicated in IE

fields.description: The PageAwareInterceptor returns a 404 if a space isn't specified for a PageAware action. This is the case even if your action returns false for isPageRequired(). So in effect, the page is optional but the space is not.
fields.summary: PageAwareInterceptor requires a space

fields.description:
Wording for 'Default Theme' in the 'Choose Theme' section on the Create Space page is not quite correct. It currently states:
"This is the default Confluence look and feel. We recommend this theme for most use cases and for evaluating Confluence. Furthermore, our documentation is based on this theme. You can customise colour-schemes and layouts manually and also apply CSS-based changes to this theme easily."

Our documentation is no longer based on the default theme, so the sentence, "Furthermore, our documentation is based on this theme.", should be removed.
fields.summary: Wording for 'Default Theme' on Create Space page is incorrect

fields.description:
Rich text editor jumps to top of page when auto saving draft in IE8.

The steps to reproduce this issue.

1) Edit a page
2) In the Rich Text Editor, add plenty of content to cause the editor window to scroll. Keep your cursor at the last line of text
3) Wait 60 seconds for the auto-save draft to take place.
4) Your editor window will auto-scroll to near the top.
fields.summary: Rich text editor jumps to top of page when auto saving draft in IE8

fields.description: The thread dump plugin does not generate output that can be used with common thread dump analysis tools like tda (https://tda.dev.java.net/).
fields.summary: Thread dump plugin generates thread dump that cannot be viewed in TDA (thread dump analyzer)
